ISSUE.TITLE: [Bug]: `--userns nomap` & `keep-id` block `--userns auto`
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description If a container exists, that was created with `--userns nomap` or `keep-id` any attempt to create a container with the option `--userns auto` fails with: `Error: creating container storage: could not find enough available IDs`. When the nomap/keep-id container is removed, creating a container with `--userns auto` works as expected. ### Steps to reproduce the issue 1. `podman create --userns nomap alpine` - Create container with `--userns nomap` or `keep-id` 2. `podman create --userns auto alpine` - Try to create one with `--userns auto` ### Describe the results you received Creation of the `--userns auto` Container fails if a container with `--userns nomap` or `--userns keep-id` exists. `Error: creating container storage: could not find enough available IDs` ### Describe the results you expected Successful creation of the container in a unique userns. ### podman info output ```shell host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.28.0 cgroupControllers: - cpuset - cpu - io - memory - pids cgroupManager: systemd cgroupVersion: v2 conmon: package: conmon-2.1.5-1.fc37.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.1.5, commit: ' cpuUtilization: idlePercent: 98.83 systemPercent: 0.49 userPercent: 0.68 cpus: 4 distribution: distribution: fedora variant: iot version: "37" eventLogger: journald hostname: podbook idMappings: gidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1000 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 2147483648 uidmap: - container_id: 0 host_id: 1000 size: 1 - container_id: 1 host_id: 100000 size: 2147483648 kernel: 6.1.7-200.fc37.x86_64 linkmode: dynamic logDriver: journald memFree: 492281856 memTotal: 8090230784 networkBackend: netavark ociRuntime: name: crun package: crun-1.7.2-3.fc37.x86_64 path: /usr/bin/crun version: |- crun version 1.7.2 commit: 0356bf4aff9a133d655dc13b1d9ac9424706cac4 rundir: /run/user/1000/crun spec: 1.0.0 +SYSTEMD +SELINUX +APPARMOR +CAP +SECCOMP +EBPF +CRIU +LIBKRUN +WASM:wasmedge +YAJL os: linux remoteSocket: exists: true path: /run/user/1000/podman/podman.sock security: apparmorEnabled: false capabilities: CAP_CHOWN,CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE,CAP_FOWNER,CAP_FSETID,CAP_KILL,CAP_NET_BIND_SERVICE,CAP_SETFCAP,CAP_SETGID,CAP_SETPCAP,CAP_SETUID,CAP_SYS_CHROOT rootless: true seccompEnabled: true seccompProfilePath: /usr/share/containers/seccomp.json selinuxEnabled: true serviceIsRemote: false slirp4netns: executable: /usr/bin/slirp4netns package: slirp4netns-1.2.0-8.fc37.x86_64 version: |- slirp4netns version 1.2.0 commit: 656041d45cfca7a4176f6b7eed9e4fe6c11e8383 libslirp: 4.7.0 SLIRP_CONFIG_VERSION_MAX: 4 libseccomp: 2.5.3 swapFree: 8085041152 swapTotal: 8089759744 uptime: 48h 31m 14.00s (Approximately 2.00 days) plugins: authorization: null log: - k8s-file - none - passthrough - journald network: - bridge - macvlan volume: - local registries: search: - registry.fedoraproject.org - registry.access.redhat.com - docker.io - quay.io store: configFile: /var/home/admin/.config/containers/storage.conf containerStore: number: 9 paused: 0 running: 3 stopped: 6 graphDriverName: overlay graphOptions: {} graphRoot: /home/admin/.local/share/containers/storage graphRootAllocated: 170259980288 graphRootUsed: 49255747584 graphStatus: Backing Filesystem: extfs Native Overlay Diff: "true" Supports d_type: "true" Using metacopy: "false" imageCopyTmpDir: /var/tmp imageStore: number: 56 runRoot: /run/user/1000/containers volumePath: /home/admin/.local/share/containers/storage/volumes version: APIVersion: 4.3.1 Built: 1668178887 BuiltTime: Fri Nov 11 16:01:27 2022 GitCommit: "" GoVersion: go1.19.2 Os: linux OsArch: linux/amd64 Version: 4.3.1 ``` ### Podman in a container No ### Privileged Or Rootless Rootless ### Upstream Latest Release Yes ### Additional environment details _No response_ ### Additional information Also tested on podman-4.4.0-rc2

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #17354 from travier/quadlet-examples [CI:DOCS] docs/podman-systemd.unit: Update example to work out of the box + Explicitely mention '.network' units

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Clarify `nomap` constrains Related to #17336 Signed-off-by: salevdns <24809481+salevdns@users.noreply.github.com> Eliminate redundancy Signed-off-by: salevdns <24809481+salevdns@users.noreply.github.com>
